tweets.text: @lisegirl1 @EnvAgency Don‚Äôt Lise, it is unbelievable to see this, no offence to yourself, as you live there and I know the effort you put in. But, can‚Äôt imagine how the likes of @brianlancastle @Severnsidebirds must be feeling

Well done Greg. This must be stopped. We found out yesterday that the water discharge permit issued by the @EnvAgency to HS2 allows quality 10 times worse than other river dischargers. Up to 10 million litres per day. https://t.co/B8280nniCa

tweets.text: @bri66thomp @EnvAgency I know Bri. A few miles of it too üòî

In sadder news ..the @EnvAgency have started destruction of all hedges behind the flood bank. where we see whitethroats, Lesser Whitethroats, Linnets, just up from where the firecrest was. So called ‚Äòmitigation‚Äô is planned but you can‚Äôt replace this. So depressing. New Passage. https://t.co/QM3JTRA3iU

We have checked on the Hallam area of Warrington this afternoon. The water is receding but the impact remains. Flood warnings are still in place - check them here: https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn https://t.co/prF2FzSZJF

@EnvAgencyNW are you all over this?

Second @CanalRiverTrust local breach/pollution event in recent years... https://t.co/TUXSydBN8u
@lisegirl1 @EnvAgency Unfortunately we suffered this destruction on Commissioners Bank at Tetney. Except the ü§¨ EA didn't do any 'mitigation' in our case. They are jobs worths.

Keep up to date with the #floods in #Worcester - follow @EnvAgencyMids @WorcsTravel @WMerciaPolice @HWFire @DaveThroupEA @worcscc #FloodAware check out the latest flood warning info at https://t.co/XBUFQ6NIDW https://t.co/Iv9x9GPRHf
@lisegirl1 @EnvAgency This is a F****** crying shameüò°
Quick update: @EnvAgencyNW was very fast to respond to our concerns and have already been on site to develop a plan for the river bank repair. Very efficient considering they are so busy. üòÅ
@CllrMaryM @MCCWythenshawe @GMPWythenshawe @CllrNigel @MikeKaneMP @S_A_Russell @maddy_monaghan @CllrSLynch @HighwaysNWEST @EnvAgency Is the level dropping?

tweets.text: @lisegirl1 @EnvAgency That's awful. 'Mitigation' - That's like the answer a Tory minister replied when asked about the destruction of  ancient woodland which were about to be destroyed for HS2, his reply was we'll replace it.
@lisegirl1 @EnvAgency As someone who visits almost every month this is frustrating.

In Didsbury today I saw the brilliant work the @EnvAgency and emergency services are doing to defend the area from flooding.

If you think your home may be at risk of flooding, please follow the advice and be prepared: https://t.co/HnN45WjPXD https://t.co/7ltbpezYL8

tweets.text: ‚ö†Ô∏è Hylton Road #Worcester will be closing around 7pm for the closure of the flood gate - at the same time A44 Bull Ring, St John's will reopen westbound up to Henwick Road https://t.co/LGJULU7vK2
@JoKingDevon @GolfStarcross @EnvAgencySW @SouthWestWater @HighwaysSWEST @Teignbridge @networkrail Well done Jo I might get out tomoz and do a bit myself.

Brearley Fields this morning, soon to be wetlands, I can‚Äôt wait üòä it definitely lends itself to a wetlands project After the deluge over the last few days it‚Äôs pretty full. Soon it will be attracting some wonderful wildlife @Calderdale @EnvAgencyYNE #wetlands #nature https://t.co/5jqIDArwrj

@BrentGoose @JoKingDevon @GolfStarcross @EnvAgencySW @SouthWestWater @HighwaysSWEST @Teignbridge @networkrail Continued ... the voles and all wildlife will suffer with salt inundation , but again thank you for clearing the ditches , we encourage all the wildlife we can there as the geese etc keep all the grass down and then it‚Äôs easier for our April opening time, keep safe everyone üòÅ

Often after #UKfloods, people say 'rivers need to be cleared'. Actually, no, rivers *need* obstructions to hold back water and #slowtheflow to reduce #flooding downstream. Putting more #leakydams in will help (or more #beavers!) @EnvAgency @WildTroutTrust @BBCWinterwatch https://t.co/ZdYqbjqnxR

tweets.text:
First update of the day from our crews in Surrey:

Protecting communities near #Guildford by keeping the waters flowing...
#floodaware 

Three jobs for you:
1. Sign-up for flood alerts: https://t.co/yL8HtxIlRB
2. Don't drive through floodwater
3. Keep away from swollen rivers https://t.co/1OVwhlLmDI

Our field operations officers have been out and about clearing trash screens of debris, in & around Tees Valley, in response to the conditions arising during #StormChristoph. The locations included Loftus Beck in Redcar & Cleveland and Courtney Walk in #Middlesbrough #SafetyFirst https://t.co/79NTRlamso

urls.title: The Prime Minister visits Didsbury following Storm Christoph
urls.description: This week, Storm Christoph brought heavy rain to very wet ground and full rivers. Today, I joined the Prime Minister who visited Didsbury in Greater Manchester where properties were evacuated. When we arrived the channel leading to the flood storage ‚Ä¶

tweets.text: Yesterday with the PM I visited Didsbury where properties were evacuated following #StormChristoph. @EnvAgency‚Äôs flood defences held firm and 23,000 properties in Greater Manchester were protected. Here‚Äôs a blog about that + how it relates to #COP26: https://t.co/1BXemM9lnp https://t.co/0WakFBAJbk

tweets.text:
In the aftermath of #StormChristoph, some rivers in England continue to be at risk of flooding. 

Stay safe at home. If you need to go outside, be alert to the hidden dangers of flood water and check the flood risk in your area: https://t.co/xNlgwQrrt9

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/oc02mOpfVK

Great to see how well one of our projects is working for natural flood management! Truly being tested to the max! Brilliant example of nature based solutions funded and managed by @WiganCouncil @Lancswildlife @EnvAgency @HeritageFundNOR https://t.co/ceRvE9UUCv

tweets.text: More transparency and end of pipe fixes won't #EndSewagePollution. This needs a systematic approach beyond @DefraGovUK, @EnvAgency and the water industry. Without strong focus by @mhclg on minimising surface and highway drainage into sewers too it's a sticking plaster not a cure.

urls.title: Taskforce sets goal to end pollution from storm overflows
urls.description: New commitments from the water industry aim to increase transparency around storm overflows.

tweets.text:
While #StormOverflows play a role in preventing sewage from entering our streets and homes during storms or heavy rain, we want to prevent the damage they cause to rivers and bathing waters.

We‚Äôre doing this through the Storm Overflows Taskforce. Read ‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/lUoIewlbzi https://t.co/dNbzHWrWuE
